North Korea's Kim seeks 'industry revolution' in rural areas amid widening inequalityNorth Korean leader Kim Jong Un has called for an "industry revolution" in rural regions by building factories nationwide, state media KCNA said on Thursday, amid chronic food shortages and widening economic inequality. Thu, 29 Feb 2024 00:45:15 GMT RKO73PALRZNRPKEFZOUO4DINCY https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/north-koreas-kim-seeks-industry-revolution-rural-areas-amid-widening-inequality-2024-02-29/Hyonhee Shin世界亚太地区
Volkswagen, XPeng ink deal to develop two B-class battery EVsGerman automaker Volkswagen and Chinese electric vehicles maker XPeng have entered an agreement for joint development of two B-class battery EVs, the companies said on Thursday. Thu, 29 Feb 2024 00:29:36 GMT HI7QWW2AHFKAVDSYZRELADWBSE https://www.reuters.com/business/autos-transportation/volkswagen-xpeng-ink-deal-develop-two-b-class-battery-evs-2024-02-29/Reuters商业汽车与交通
China willing to enhance economic, trade cooperation with Egypt, commerce minister saysChina is willing to further promote economic and trade cooperation with Egypt, and to continue to encourage and support its enterprises to invest and start businesses in the African country, the Chinese commerce ministry cited its minister as saying. Wed, 28 Feb 2024 23:34:00 GMT NBVZFTVZJBMC3P5LSYHFZQ6HQU https://www.reuters.com/world/china-willing-enhance-economic-trade-cooperation-with-egypt-commerce-minister-2024-02-28/Reuters世界
Canada fired two scientists for sharing information with Beijing, says paperCanada fired two scientists working at a high-security infectious disease laboratory in 2021 because they provided confidential information to China, the Globe and Mail newspaper reported on Wednesday. Beijing to host 2027 World ChampionshipsBeijing has been selected to host the 2027 World Athletics Championships, governing body World Athletics said on Wednesday.
